sub_title: User Experience Designer | User Centered Design | User Research | Co-creation | Workshops | Agile | Design Thinking |
summary:
Hello! My name is Maria Gustafsson and I am a User Experience, Service and Human Experience Designer. Many names for the same passion; People and how Design matters. My innate characteristics, such as curiosity, perceptiveness, empathy and the joy of learning new things draw me to the field of User Experience. 

I enjoy being part of a team, working collaboratively in iterative projects and seeing the result being rolled out to the customers/users. UX is a team effort and working closely together with marketers, content writers, developers and product owners, in order to create the best product/service, comes naturally to me. 

Experienced in the agile world, especially with Scrum methodology. Striving for integrating UX design within agile, and how to improve this process. 

My role is to drive the UX and design projects, use my toolbox of research methods, to carry out user tests, create design concepts and prototypes and to communicate design goals to the (development) team. Passionate about giving workshops, Google Design Sprints, etc.

projects.title: The “essential” paper bowl:  Increasing the awareness of mass-produced and disposable objects in order to influence wasting behavior
projects.description: The present study explored ways to attribute psychological essence to an object, in order to increase its perceived value, and consequently influence wasting behavior.  We hypothesized that increasing the history awareness of an object, by making the history of an object salient, would add essence to a mass-produced and disposable object. The increased essence will lead to less wasteful behavior, or when people are given the choice, will lead them to choose less wasteful alternatives. For example, choose a more sustainable ceramic bowl over a disposable paper bowl. In the present research, we conducted three studies with the goal to empirically investigate the concept of essence. Study 1 provided initial support that usage of a timeline is a successful method to increase the salience of an objects history, and consequently increase its historic essence. Study 3 replicated this finding and further demonstrated that people presented with the timeline assigned the same amount of essence to the paper bowl as to the ceramic bowl. In addition, the timeline manipulation made people more aware of the wastefulness of the paper bowl, especially for people who were not concerned about the environment. Interestingly, the timeline increased the awareness of the paper bowl but had no such effect on the ceramic bowl. This implies that the timeline per se does not matter, it only matters for the paper bowl. It can be assumed that mass-produced and disposable objects lack this awareness, and that the timeline was effective in making people more aware that the paper bowl has a history. Our study revealed preliminary results, demonstrating that essence can be manipulated by history awareness. Our findings show that it is possible, with small means, to change the way we perceive objects. This opens up new applications where the concept of essence can be used.

projects.title: Research Project: The association between visual shininess and the concept of clean: The activation of cleaning behavior by a shiny environment.
projects.description: Littering is a growing social and environmental problem, which often happens without us being aware of it. Information campaigns attempt to raise knowledge and awareness of the problem, but are unsuccessful in reaching behavioral change. Furthermore, it is known that environmental cues can influence behavior, and that implicit information in the environment activates behavior. Recent research showed that shiny activates the concept of clean. More specifically, there exists a cognitive link between visual aspects of clean, namely shininess and cleanliness. Therefore, we investigated the effect of a shiny environment on cleaning behavior. Specifically, we wanted to test the behavioral effect of the cognitive link between visual shininess and behavior. We expected that a shiny environment would activate more cleaning behavior than a dull environment. In addition a process measure was designed to check for concept activation. The results demonstrated that there exists a behavioral effect between visual shininess and behavior. The shiny tabletop manipulation had a significant effect on cleaning behavior. Participants showed more overall cleaning behaviors in the shiny environment than in the dull environment. Additionally, completing the process task on a shiny tabletop activated more clean-related words than in the control condition.

projects.title: HTI Track B: Natural light: A naturalness bias in lighting
projects.description: A naturalness bias has been defined as ‘a preference for things perceived as natural’. In this project we attempted to answer the question whether a naturalness bias exist in the context of lighting, and whether people’s sense of personal connection to nature and their beliefs towards different types of lighting affect its occurrence. Four studies were used to evaluate the effectiveness of two paradigms of measuring a naturalness bias in the context of lighting. Results indicate that the two presented paradigms did not reliably measure a naturalness bias in the context of lighting. People’s connectedness to nature and beliefs towards different light kinds were reliably and validly measured, providing future research with a good frame of reference for evaluating the effectiveness of other paradigms of measuring a naturalness bias in the context of lighting.

employing creativity & collaboration to facilitate research & innovation in preventative health

projects.title: HTI Track A: Increasing exercise motivation through social interaction
projects.description: The assignment was formulated in collaboration with Philips DirectLife to gain understanding how social interaction can increase exercise motivation. Several user research methods where used as a basis of our research including interviews, brainstorm sessions, storyboards, focus groups, and concept validation. In the end we defined requirements to which extensions to the existing DirectLife web service should adhere. Our results show that adding several extensions to the DirectLife web service that increase social interaction can enhance both intrinsic and extrinsic motivation.

profile_positions.description:
Working at an Eindhoven based startup that helps professionals to learn from
each other with an online mentoring platform. Working in a 4-person Scrum team as the user experience expert, with the goal to iteratively improve and extend the platform with new functionalities.
profile_positions.title: UX Designer

profile_positions.description: As an USI expert, I am specialized in user- centered interaction design methods. That means, identifying user needs, requirements, and opportunities for innovation with interactive technologies.
profile_positions.title: Professional Doctorate In Engineering In User System Interaction

profile_positions.description:
Currently working on a 10 week Design Case project, with Nedap as stakeholder. 

Design a solution that supports healthcare practitioners (Doctors, nurses, physiotherapists and psychologists) in healthcare environments in viewing/editing and interpreting patient measurement information more efficiency and with more ease than in the current situation.
profile_positions.title: Data visualization in Electronic Healthcare Recors (EHR)

profile_positions.description: Organizing yearly USI activities; such as New Years drink, BBQ, anniversary party and UXcampNL Contacting sponsors.
profile_positions.title: Vice President

profile_positions.description:
This project was a collaboration between Philips Healthcare located in Best and User System Interaction (USI). Philips is currently working on bringing harmonization, coherence and consistency to all their health care applications. This assignment was part of this project, and is about redesigning the help function, focusing on one of their applications. 
Worked in a team of 3, where we did an extensive literature and benchmarking research, formed guidelines for instructional design, developed two concepts which we tested in a user evaluation.
profile_positions.title: Instructional design for user guidance

profile_positions.description:
The scope of this project was to create a new social context for Philips HUE, and to create a new personal experience with the product/technology.

Our goal was to make Philips hue usable in everyday life and to connect people living together. We aimed at making the time the family spends at home more qualitative. ‘Getting App with Hue’ is about a whole experience that helps with the rhythm, adapt to family activities and makes it more pleasant to get up in the morning, etc.
profile_positions.title: Getting App with Hue

profile_positions.description: The current traffic management system is outdated, and less and less able to meet the latest demands for fast and reliable traffic information. Therefore, our role in this project was to make a redesign proposal of a user interface design to manage traffic jam information for the national highway traffic control center (VCNL – Verkeerscentrum NL).
profile_positions.title: BASTIAAN - User Interface Design to Manage Traffic Jam Information

volunteer_experiences.description: Helping organizing the event. Being part of the committee of volunteers.  Responsible for recruiting volunteers, organizing and planning the volunteer pool required before and during the festival days.

volunteer_experiences.role: Organizer of Eindhoven Girl Geek Dinner
volunteer_experiences.description:
Girl Geek Dinners is a social networking event that is intended to encourage women to explore science, technology and other male-dominated areas. . The idea behind the Girl Geek Dinner is simple – we invite women who are kicking-ass in their respective fields, and we ask them to give an informal talk, where they can describe themselves and their work. This is followed by a Q&A session.
Started up the event in Eindhoven 2010, and have since then organized three girl geek dinners, each with two speakers and about 40 participants.

UXcampNL is an unconference born from the desire to bring together the industry and academic communities to share knowledge in an open environment. It is an intense one day event with presentations, discussions, workshops and demos in the field of User Experience. 

UXcamp NL is organized yearly in Eindhoven. 2014 was its 3th edition, and we strive to become bigger, more well-known but without loosing our personal feeling.
